definitions.text: (immunology) the attraction between an antigen and an antibody
(anthropology) kinship by marriage or adoption; not a blood relationship
(biology) state of relationship between organisms or groups of organisms resulting in resemblance in structure or structural parts
examples: in anatomical structure prehistoric man shows close affinity with modern humans

definitions.text: a close connection marked by community of interests or similarity in nature or character
examples: found a natural affinity with the immigrants
felt a deep kinship with the other students

definitions.text: the force attracting atoms to each other and binding them together in a molecule
examples: basic dyes have an affinity for wool and silk

definitions.text: inherent resemblance between persons or things
a natural attraction or feeling of kinship
